<title level="1" pfs="">[Clockwork Sphinx](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1948)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

This imposing construct resembles a bronze lion with the wings of a great bird and the head of a humanoid.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)): DC 29

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 8">[Clockwork Sphinx](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1948)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Clockwork" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=331" />
<trait label="Construct" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=35" />
<trait label="Mindless" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=108" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #179: Cradle of Quartz](/Sources.aspx?ID=122) pg. 81</row>

**Perception** +19; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +16, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +18

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +4

**Con** +4

**Int** -5

**Wis** +3

**Cha** -5
</row>

**Wind-Up** 24 hours, DC 24, standby

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 26 

**Fort** +18 

**Ref** +16 

**Will** +13 

</row>

**HP** 130

**Immunities**
death effects, disease, doomed, drained, fatigued, healing, mental, necromancy, nonlethal attacks, paralyzed, poisoned, sickened, unconscious

**Resistances**
physical 10 (except adamantine or orichalcum)

**Weaknesses**
electricity 10, orichalcum 10

**Self-Destruct** ([arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) When a clockwork sphinx is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it collapses and emits a steady ticking sound. At the beginning of what would've been its next turn, the sphinx explodes into a 20-foot emanation of shrapnel, dealing 6d10 piercing damage (DC 26 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). An adjacent creature can cancel the self-destruct sequence by succeeding at a DC 26 [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) check to [Disable a Device](/Actions.aspx?ID=69) at any point before the sphinx explodes, but on a critical failure, it explodes immediately.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, fly 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +20,
**Damage** 2d12+9 slashing

**Pounce** <actions string="Single Action" />  **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The sphinx Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the sphinx began this action [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22), it remains hidden until after the attack.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Other Looks</title>

The clockwork sphinx bears a resemblance to an actual sphinx more out of tradition than any intrinsic requirement. As such, some creators build these creatures to resemble other flying quadrupedal creatures, such as [chimeras](/Monsters.aspx?ID=80), [manticores](/Monsters.aspx?ID=294), or even [dragons](/Traits.aspx?ID=50). Regardless of appearance, the clockwork sphinx's statistics remain the same.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-223" />
name: Clockwork Sphinx
